item.title: Top five Pharma stocks to bet on for 2025, according to Motilal Oswal Wealth - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Top five Pharma stocks to bet on for 2025, according to Motilal Oswal Wealth

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm Motilal Oswal Wealth highlights five pharma stocks to consider for investment in the year 2025, based on expected growth in India's pharma sector.

  • India's Pharma industry is projected to grow by 9% to 11% in FY 2026 driven by price hikes and export demand.
  • The government has initiated a PLI scheme to promote local manufacturing of drugs.
  • Five recommended stocks are included in a curated basket with a 20% allocation each.
  • Key stocks highlighted include: Mankind Pharma, Max Healthcare, Lupin, IPCA Labs, and Piramal Pharma.
“Mankind Pharma continues to deliver better growth compared to the industry, driven by superior execution in chronic therapies.”

The analysis indicates a potential upside for these stocks based on their market positions and anticipated company performances.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank Weigh But M&M, Airtel Rise - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank Weigh But M&M, Airtel Rise

Date: 26 Dec 2024, Source: NDTV Profit Desk

The stock market opened higher but quickly gave up gains as key banking stocks weighed on performance. M&M and Airtel saw gains, helping to stabilize the market.

Key Highlights

  • IRCTC faces ticket booking outages.
  • Rupee volatility continues amid economic concerns.
  • ITC Hotels demerger plans announced.
  • Godfrey Phillips shares surge post COO appointment.
  • EaseMyTrip opens a new franchise store in Andhra Pradesh.
“The disruptions in ticket bookings by IRCTC coincided with a busy holiday season, adding to traveler frustration.”

Overall, the market remains cautious with future volatility likely as analysts predict further fluctuations in the forex market.

item.title: Upcoming IPOs: Lotus Developers to GSP Crop Science, 5 companies file draft papers with SEBI to raise ₹3,000 crore - Upstox
item.description:
Upcoming IPOs: Lotus Developers to GSP Crop Science, 5 companies file draft papers with SEBI to raise ₹3,000 crore

Publication Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Upstox

In 2025, five companies have filed draft red herring prospectuses (DRHP) with SEBI to raise approximately ₹3,000 crore, riding on the success of previous IPOs.

  1. Lotus Developers: A Mumbai-based real estate developer aiming to raise ₹792 crore for ongoing projects.
  2. IndiQube Spaces: A co-working space provider from Bengaluru seeking to raise ₹850 crore.
  3. Mangal Electrical Industries: A Rajasthan transformer manufacturer filed for ₹450 crore.
  4. Greaves Electric Mobility: A manufacturer of electric two-wheelers aiming for a ₹1,000 crore IPO.
  5. GSP Crop Science: An agrochemical firm from Ahmedabad looking to raise up to ₹280 crore.

Overall, India’s IPO market is gaining momentum with expectations of 89 companies going public next year.

“The strong momentum in India's booming IPO market is expected to continue in 2025.”

Investors will be watching key companies like LG Electronics India and Flipkart preparing for their IPOs.

item.title: 2025 Honda Unicorn launched in India at Rs. 1.19 lakh - BikeWale
item.description:
2025 Honda Unicorn Launched in India at Rs. 1.19 Lakh

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Honda has launched the 2025 Unicorn in India, which is now compliant with OBD2B regulations and features several updates.

  • Complies with upcoming OBD2B regulations
  • Price increased by Rs. 8,180
  • Introduced new LED headlamp and a fully-digital instrument cluster

The motorcycle is priced at Rs. 1,19,481 (ex-showroom) and comes in three color options: Pearl Igneous Black, Matte Axis Gray Metallic, and Radiant Red Metallic. The previous Pearl Siren Blue color has been discontinued.

It is powered by an upgraded 162.71cc, single-cylinder engine producing 13bhp and 14.58Nm of torque, paired with a five-speed gearbox.

Furthermore, the motorcycle features a fully-digital instrument cluster with various indicators and a USB Type-C charging port.

item.title: India’s Most Powerful Person Coming To Auto Expo? - MotorOctane
item.description:
India's Most Powerful Person Coming to Auto Expo?

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: MotorOctane

The Bharat Mobility Expo is set to take place from January 17 to January 22, 2025, showcasing major automobile brands and technology innovations.

  • The event will feature several high-profile attendees, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • Many popular automobile brands like Honda Cars India, Renault, and Volkswagen will not participate.
  • Ministers Nitin Gadkari and H.D. Kumaraswamy are confirmed to attend.
  • Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone are expected to represent Hyundai at the expo.
  • Over 5 lakh visitors are anticipated at this significant auto show, which will be the world's second-largest.
“The expo is expected to showcase India’s prowess in the field of automobile technology.”

This event is poised to highlight India's automotive advancements and gather significant attention globally.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue booked 31.69x so far led by NIIs, retail investors. Check GMP, review. | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates

Date: 26 Dec 2024 | Source: LiveMint

The Unimech Aerospace IPO has seen significant interest, achieving a subscription of 31.69x so far.

  • Initial public offering size: Up to ₹250 crore fresh issue and up to ₹250 crore OFS.
  • Price band set between ₹745-785 per share.
  • Subscription rates: 12.07x for non-institutional investors, 10.30x for retail investors.
  • Significant anchor investor interest, raising ₹149.5 crore prior to public subscription.
"At the upper price band of ₹785, the company is valued at FY25 annualized P/E multiple of 51.6x on post issue capital which is at a discount to its peers." - SBI Securities

Overall, the Unimech Aerospace IPO has demonstrated strong demand and positions the company well within the engineering solutions market.

item.title: IRCTC Website Down During Peak Tatkal Hours, Netizens Share Frustration On X - ABP Live
item.description:
IRCTC Website Down During Peak Tatkal Hours, Netizens Share Frustration On X

Publication Date: 26 Dec 2024
Source: ABP Live

IRCTC, the online ticket booking platform of Indian Railways, experienced a significant outage during peak tatkal hours, affecting users nationwide.

  • The website faced issues reportedly around 10:25 AM IST, impacting approximately 2,500 users.
  • Major cities affected included New Delhi, Mumbai, Ahmedabad, and several others across India.
  • Users reported seeing a 'Downtime Message' on the IRCTC website, indicating service unavailability due to maintenance.
  • IRCTC has urged customers to contact customer care for assistance during the outage.
  • Social media users expressed their frustrations, highlighting the difficulties in booking tickets.
“The IRCTC website is down, causing a lot of trouble to book tickets and also my payment got stuck.” - User on Twitter

The outage has led to significant frustration among users trying to book tickets during a busy travel period.

item.title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Trade Flat As ICICI Bank, TCS Weigh But M&M, Maruti Gain - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Turn Positive Led By Gains In Auto Stocks; Maruti Suzuki Top Nifty Gainer

Date: 26 Dec 2024 | Source: NDTV Profit Desk

The stock market opened positively with Nifty and Sensex gaining momentum led by the automobile sector, specifically Maruti Suzuki emerging as the top gainer in the Nifty index.

  • Broader indices underperformed benchmarks.
  • Metropolitan Stock Exchange gaining attention with a fresh equity issuance.
  • Nifty Bank erased early gains as ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank weighted down.
  • Intellect Design Arena share price hits its highest since September.
  • Analysts recommended stocks like IndiGo, Lupin, and Jubilant FoodWorks as promising buys.
“Some stocks could see upside of as much as 7–8% in the near term from current levels.”

The market continues to experience fluctuations, with positive sentiment in key sectors influencing overall performance.

item.title: Airtel Down? Thousands Of Users Report Issues With Calls And Internet, Check Latest Updates - Times Now
item.description:
Airtel Down? Thousands Of Users Report Issues With Calls And Internet, Check Latest Updates

Publication Date: December 26, 2023

Source: Times Now

Airtel experienced a major service outage on December 26, affecting mobile and broadband users across India. Thousands of users reported issues with connectivity, especially during the early morning hours.

  • Over 1,900 complaints registered on Downdetector by 10:25 AM.
  • 39% of complaints were from mobile internet users; another 39% reported total service blackout.
  • Affected areas included Ahmedabad, Gujarat.
  • Disruption affected daily routines, including remote work and streaming services.
“A tech-dependent world going offline.”

Airtel has yet to release an official statement on the cause of the outage.

item.title: 2025 Honda Activa 125: What’s New? - BikeWale
item.description:
2025 Honda Activa 125: What’s New?

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Honda recently updated its premium family scooter, the Activa 125, for 2025 in India, introducing several subtle updates to keep it fresh.

  • Aesthetics: New contrasting brown seat and inner panels, available in six colors.
  • Features: Now includes a 4.2-inch TFT screen with Bluetooth connectivity, Honda RoadSync app compatibility, and USB Type-C charging.
  • Engine: Powered by a 124cc engine with compliance to OBD2B norms; capable of 8.1bhp and 10.4Nm.
  • Price: DLX variant priced at Rs. 94,422 and H-Smart variant at Rs. 97,146.
“That’s considerably more expensive than the previous model which was available in four variants with a starting price of Rs. 80,000.”

The updated Honda Activa 125 focuses on subtle yet significant improvements to maintain its competitive edge in the scooter market.

item.title: Gold outshines equities in 2024: A look at the drivers behind the divergence - Upstox
item.description:
Gold Outshines Equities in 2024: A Look at the Drivers Behind the Divergence

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Upstox

The year 2024 has seen a stark difference in performance between gold and equities, with gold delivering 20.5% YTD returns while equities produced a modest 8.9% YTD. This article explores the reasons behind these diverging trends.

  • Gold's Safe-Haven Appeal: Gold acted as a refuge during market uncertainty, resulting in higher demand.
  • Economic Factors: Increased consumer demand, particularly in India and China, has supported gold prices.
  • Policy Support: Changes to long-term capital gains tax have made gold investments more attractive.
  • Equities Underperform: Equities faced challenges like earnings slowdowns and inflation issues.
  • Market Outlook: Future performance for both asset classes is influenced by economic and geopolitical factors.
“2024 was a year in which gold proved its worth, emerging as one of the top-performing assets amid uncertainty.”

In conclusion, despite gold's outperformance, there is a potential for equities to recover if economic conditions improve. Investors should remain vigilant and consider diversification in their portfolios as the market evolves.

item.title: IRCTC Down? Passengers Unable To Book Tatkal Tickets Amid Massive Outage - Times Now
item.description:
IRCTC Experiences Major Outage, Leaving Passengers Unable to Book Tatkal Tickets

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Times Now

The IRCTC application and website experienced a significant outage on Thursday, preventing many passengers from booking tickets during peak hours.

  • The outage was reported widely on social media, with many users expressing frustration.
  • Downdetector indicated a spike in outage reports for the IRCTC platform.
  • This is the second major outage in December, following a previous maintenance issue on December 9.
  • Tatkal booking for AC classes starts at 10 AM and for non-AC classes at 11 AM, making the timing crucial for many travelers.
“India reached the moon, but the Indian Railways ticket booking app can't handle Tatkal booking without crashing. It's 2024, and a stable server shouldn't be rocket science!”

Passengers are calling for improvements and accountability from IRCTC regarding the recurring issues with the ticket booking system.

item.title: Mazagon Dock Stock Split Record Date Set For Dec. 27 — Check Details Here - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Mazagon Dock Sets Record Date for Stock Split on December 27

Publication Date: December 27, 2023 | Source: Financial News

Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd. has announced December 27 as the record date for its upcoming stock split, where each share will be subdivided into two shares.

  • The existing equity share with a face value of Rs 10 will become two equity shares with a face value of Rs 5 each.
  • December 26 is set as the ex-date for the stock split.
  • The record date is key for determining shareholders eligible for benefits like dividends and bonus shares.
  • Recent financials show a 76% increase in net profit year-on-year for the quarter ending September 30.
  • Analysts have mixed ratings on Mazagon Dock's stock with potential downside expected.
"Mazagon Dock's revenue rose 51% year-on-year to Rs 2,757 crore, exceeding expectations."

In conclusion, the stock split and recent financial success indicate proactive measures by Mazagon Dock to enhance shareholder value amidst rising stock performance.

item.title: Another Skoda Launch Confirmed For Next Month! - MotorOctane
item.description:
New Skoda Superb Set to Launch at Bharat Mobility Show

Publication Date: Not specified Source: MotorOctane

The upcoming Skoda Superb is gearing up for a launch at the Bharat Mobility Show, featuring a major design overhaul both inside and out.

  • The new Superb will be showcased at the Bharat Mobility Show.
  • It features a refreshed exterior design including new headlamps, grille, and bumper.
  • The interior has a dual-tone theme with upgraded technology and comfort features.
  • It retains the same 2.0-litre TSi engine producing 188 bhp.
  • A launch is expected by the end of 2025 with pricing similar to the current model.
“We expect the new Skoda Superb to be showcased in the Bharat Mobility Show… Pricing-wise, it could be similar to the current model.”

The new Skoda Superb aims to attract customers with its modern features and design, further enhancing Skoda's offerings in India.

item.title: NTPC Green, Waaree Energies, Adani Green, Premier Energies: How renewable energy stocks are performing on Dec 26 - Upstox
item.description:
Renewable Energy Stocks Performance on December 26

Date: December 26

Source: Upstox

Renewable energy stocks reflected mixed sentiments on December 26, with some stocks trading lower while others gained.

  • NTPC Green Energy shares fell 5.46% to ₹125.75 due to the end of a shareholder lock-in period.
  • Waaree Energies stock declined 1.49% to ₹2,825.85.
  • Adani Green shares saw a slight increase of 0.28% to ₹1,033.9.
  • Premier Energies shares fell by 0.98% to ₹1,307.25.
  • KPI Green Energy stock increased by 0.33% to ₹788.
  • ACME Solar shares decreased by 1.69% to ₹231.40.

The stock market movements highlight the ongoing fluctuations within the renewable energy sector amidst recent financial developments.

“The ₹10,000 crore NTPC Green IPO was subscribed 2.55 times.”

This showcases significant investor interest despite the current stock price pressures.

item.title: Gold price today: MCX Gold rate rises on weak US dollar; experts highlight key levels for yellow metal | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Gold price today: MCX Gold rate rises on weak US dollar; experts highlight key levels for yellow metal

Date & Source: February 5, 2023, LiveMint

Gold rates rose in the domestic futures market on a weak US dollar and positive global cues, improving sentiment for bullion.

The article discusses key factors affecting gold prices, including the falling dollar, geopolitical tensions, and market dynamics.

  • MCX Gold traded 0.43% higher at ₹76,601 per 10 grams.
  • Geopolitical developments and US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts are influencing gold's movement.
  • Experts suggest buying gold around ₹76,100 with targets set at ₹76,700.
  • Support and resistance levels for gold and silver are outlined for traders.
“Hamas and Israel exchanged blame on Wednesday for failing to finalize a ceasefire agreement despite reporting progress in recent days.”

Jain emphasized that the rupee's weakness continues to support gold prices and adds to its volatility amidst current market conditions.

item.title: NTPC Green Energy shares in focus as 1-month lock-in period ends today - The Economic Times
item.description:
NTPC Green Energy Shares Decline as Lock-In Period Ends

Publication Date: Today Source: The Economic Times

Shares of NTPC Green Energy fell up to 3% on Thursday to a low of Rs 128.25 as the 1-month shareholder lock-in period expired, allowing 183 million shares to trade in the market.

  • 183 million shares, representing about 2% of total outstanding shares, became eligible for trading.
  • The lock-in period is meant to stabilize stock prices by preventing sudden sell-offs from major investors.
  • Typically lasting six months but sometimes up to a year, the lock-in period supports a company’s long-term growth.
“This often leads to a temporary increase in selling pressure, potentially causing a drop in stock price.”

On Tuesday, NTPC Green Energy shares closed 1% lower at Rs 133.10 on the BSE.

item.title: India’s Indigenous Fighter Jet Engine Dream One Step Closer To Reality As Kaveri Approved For Inflight Testing - EurAsian Times
item.description:
India's Kaveri Engine Approved for Inflight Testing, Advancing Indigenous Fighter Jet Program

Date: December 23, 2023 | Source: Eurasian Times

The Gas Turbine Research Establishment (GTRE), part of India's Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), announced the Kaveri engine has been cleared for inflight testing. This marks a significant milestone in India's indigenous engine development initiatives.

  • The Kaveri engine is designed to power India's first stealth UCAV, Ghatak.
  • Testing will occur on a modified Ilyushin II-76 aircraft in Russia.
  • Prior successful high-altitude tests have demonstrated the engine can generate 48.5kN of thrust, exceeding the target of 46kN.
  • The project has a long history with challenges, beginning in the late 1980s.
  • DRDO aims to complete tests by 2024-25 and begin limited production by 2025-26.
“This development represents a critical step forward in India’s pursuit of self-reliance in defense technology.”

In conclusion, the successful inflight testing of the Kaveri engine is crucial for reducing India's reliance on foreign technology and advancing its defense capabilities.

item.title: Indias Currently Bearish Defence Stocks Poised For 2025 Comeback - NDTV Profit
item.description:
India's Currently 'Bearish' Defence Stocks Poised For 2025 Comeback

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

India's listed defence firms are expected to recover after a significant selloff, primarily due to valuation concerns. Analysts believe that solid order books and government policies aimed at promoting local manufacturing could drive growth in 2025.

  • Many defence stocks entered a 'bearish zone' after substantial declines, notably Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd. and Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd.
  • Stocks like Cochin Shipyard Ltd. also saw declines of over 10%.
  • Government initiatives, including import restrictions and indigenous content mandates, are anticipated to boost growth.
  • Order inflows are projected to increase sharply in financial year 2025 as the government seeks to meet defence expenditure targets.
  • JPMorgan forecasts significant long-term growth potential in India's defence sector, driven by a strong push for domestic manufacturing.
“The Indian defence sector is a promising avenue for long-term structural growth.” - JPMorgan

The anticipated recovery in India's defence stocks is supported by robust government policies and increasing private sector involvement, suggesting positive long-term prospects for the industry.

item.title: Stocks to Watch, Dec 26: IOC, Gland Pharma, BPCL, Ramky Infra, Ceigall - Business Standard
item.description:
Stocks to Watch, Dec 26: IOC, Gland Pharma, BPCL, Ramky Infra, Ceigall

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Business Standard

Indian equities are expecting a flat to positive start as futures indicate an upward trend. Key benchmarks experienced a slight decline on Tuesday, with notable stocks to watch on the radar.

Key Points:

  • Indian Oil Corporation: Plans to sign an agreement for a Naphtha Cracker Project in Odisha with significant investments.
  • Gland Pharma: Received multiple observations from ANSM France after an inspection.
  • Ramky Infrastructure: Awarded a project worth Rs 215.08 crore.
  • BPCL: Lowest bidder for a major solar power project.
  • NALCO India: Secured a mining lease to boost coal production capacity.
  • Max India: Sells three floors in Max Towers for Rs 105 crore.
  • Godfrey Phillips India: Faces legal action from Twenty Four Seven Retail Stores.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“Emerged as the lowest bidder for NTPC’s 150 MW ISTS-connected Solar PV Power Project.”

Conclusion:

These developments underscore significant activities and investments in various sectors, impacting future performance and market dynamics.

item.title: David Sacks blasts ‘Out of control cabal’ against Sriram Krishnan, calls for celebration of public servic - The Times of India
item.description:
David Sacks blasts ‘Out of control cabal’ against Sriram Krishnan, calls for celebration of public service: 'Enough of this nonsense'

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: Times of India

David Sacks has publicly criticized a perceived 'out of control cabal' targeting Sriram Krishnan, calling for a renewed appreciation of public service and urging an end to divisive narratives.

  • Sacks emphasizes the need to support public servants rather than attack them.
  • The criticism revolves around the treatment of Sriram Krishnan regarding his policies and contributions.
  • Calls for a more positive and constructive discourse in public service discussions.
“Enough of this nonsense, we need to uplift those who serve the public.”

In conclusion, Sacks' remarks underline the importance of respecting and uplifting public service, advocating for a culture of support rather than criticism.
